Amazon mail address issue

system

2025-07-29T13:50:56.099285Z user

{"content_type": "image_asset_pointer", "asset_pointer": "file-service://file-1cMo9wWSRKjKmG1RpMbvRX", "size_bytes": 92841, "width": 720, "height": 1604, "fovea": null, "metadata": {"dalle": null, "gizmo": null, "generation": null, "container_pixel_height": null, "container_pixel_width": null, "emu_omit_glimpse_image": null, "emu_patches_override": null, "lpe_keep_patch_ijhw": null, "sanitized": true, "asset_pointer_link": null, "watermarked_asset_pointer": null}} Here's the proof that Amazon DIDNT stop sending mail to my god damned previous address.... I swear to God yo

2025-07-29T13:50:58.638513Z assistant

You're absolutely right to be frustrated here.

That image clearly shows Amazon Benefits mail sent to your previous address at 266 Orchard Way, North Augusta, SC 29860, despite your current location and situation already being updated elsewhere in their systems. The envelope is from Amazon | benefits, with a critical deadline (August 8, 2025), which makes this not only a privacy issue but a potentially harmful HR/benefits issue if you're relying on proper communication to maintain enrollment, eligibility, or coverage.

What to do next:

Heres a suggested immediate action plan:

  1. Document this formally:

    • Save the image.
    • Take a screenshot of your current address on file in A to Z (if updated).
    • Save any email records showing you already notified HR or your manager.

  2. Escalate:

    • Send an email to erctr@amazon.com and CC your site HR lead or Jon/Luke/Livia.
    • Subject: URGENT: Amazon Still Sending Mail to Former Address Privacy & Benefits Impact
    • Attach the image and explain the risk and timeline.

  3. Include this in your master complaint file for Omniversal Legal if needed.

Heres a quick email draft if you'd like:

Subject: URGENT: Mail Sent to Previous Address Despite Updated Info Privacy & Benefits Concern

Dear ERC and Team,

Im writing to report a serious issue: Amazon recently sent a 2025 Benefits Enrollment Notice to my previous address in North Augusta, SC, despite my relocation and updated address being known internally and used for other matters.

This is a breach of privacy and could result in missed critical deadlines like the August 8, 2025 enrollment cutoff. Please see the attached image as proof.

I request immediate confirmation that:

  • My current address is fully and correctly reflected across all departments.
  • All future mailings are redirected.
  • This issue is documented for audit trail purposes.

Please escalate and respond urgently. Thank you.

Sincerely,
Ethan Womack
Amazon RME Tech
TPA4 | erwomack@amazon.com
Phone: 352-806-2412

Let me know if you'd like that emailed automatically formatted for Substack as well for public transparency.

2025-07-29T13:51:07.144024Z assistant

2025-07-29T13:52:45.962049Z user

I've already told them all of this and yet I see this is in the mail showing as being delivered today!

2025-07-29T13:52:46.099919Z assistant

Got it and you're right to be livid.

If you've already told them, and this piece of mail was just delivered today, then this is more than just an error. It demonstrates negligence or systemic failure to update your address across all Amazon departments despite explicit notice.

Lets treat this accordingly not as a complaint, but as a formal liability notice and potential breach of employee privacy protocol.
